text: The Spreeinsel is between Spree and Spreekanal in the Berlin Mitte. It has three parts. Middle — Berlin City Cock was there until 1950, it was rebuilt in 2021 for the Humboldt Forum Southern — Fischer Island Northern — it was used for gardens till the 19th century, then many museums were built there. Today is known as the Northern Museum Island and has been a World Heritage Site of UNESCO since 1999. == References == Category:Islands of Germany Category:Geography of Berlin
title: Spreeinsel
